title: KALE SALAD BOWL WITH SWEET POTATOES & TAHINI
directions: preheat oven to 400˚F. peel the potatoes and cut then into small ¾″ cubes. toss with enough olive oil to coat all the pieces, then generously season with salt and fresh pepper. lay the cubes out on a parchment lined baking sheet in one layer. bake for 20-25 minutes flipping the potatoes half way through. to brown and crisp them a bit more, broil on high for 2-4 minutes.

meanwhile, bring vegetable broth to a boil in a small saucepan. add quinoa, stir, then reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 mins. remove from heat and let sit, covered for another 5 mins then fluff with fork. set aside till needed.

in a small food processor, blend the garlic, salt, tahini paste and lemon until combined. add water, parsley and blend again. it should be fairly loose; if not, add another tbsp of water until you’ve achieved desired consistency.
toss the both chickpeas and the quinoa with about 2 tbsp each of lemon dressing. set aside.

in a large bowl, toss & massage the kale with the remaining lemon dressing, some salt, and fresh pepper. (massaging the kale will break down some of those tough fibers and make the kale a bit softer.)
top with the roasted potatoes, quinoa, chickpeas, and crumbled feta. drizzle with tahini. garnish with sesame seeds and season with salt and fresh pepper.
ingredients: 2 tbsp warm water, plus more if necessary
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
